DOC.brief_summary: This is a study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of desloratadine (MK-4117) in Japanese participants with chronic urticaria. The primary hypothesis is that the efficacy of desloratadine 10 mg and 5 mg is superior to placebo as based on the change from Baseline in the sum score of pruritus/itch and rash as assessed by the Investigator at Week 2.
DOC.brief_title: An Efficacy and Safety Study of Desloratadine (MK-4117) in Japanese Participants With Chronic Urticaria (MK-4117-201)
DOC.criteria: Chronic urticaria [rash (erythema, wheal) for more than 1 month without any known cause] Outpatient Stimulationinduced urticaria [physical urticaria (e.g. cold, solar, and heat urticaria), cholinergic urticaria, contact urticaria)] Hypersensitivity to antihistamines or ingredients of a study drug
